publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1342 Pauline McNeill: Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus-That the Parliament congratulates the communities of Broomhill and Thornwood in Glasgow in successfully campaigning for the reinstatement of the number 83 bus; believes that First Bus reversed its decision to axe this service and will now reinstate the bus on the route on 7 January 2001 as a result of the huge public outcry, and notes that the bus operator has also bowed to community pressure and agreed to cover the route from Monday 13 November 2000 until 7 January 2001 with a temporary bus numbered 6A.
S1M-1342 Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus (lodged on 10 November 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1342 Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus (lodged on 10 November 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1342 Pauline McNeill: Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus-That the Parliament congratulates the communities of Broomhill and Thornwood in Glasgow in successfully campaigning for the reinstatement of the number 83 bus; believes that First Bus reversed its decision to axe this service and will now reinstate the bus on the route on 7 January 2001 as a result of the huge public outcry, and notes that the bus operator has also bowed to community pressure and agreed to cover the route from Monday 13 November 2000 until 7 January 2001 with a temporary bus numbered 6A. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-1342 Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus (lodged on 10 November 2000) Mr Michael McMahon*

S1M-1342 Pauline McNeill: Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus—That the Parliament congratulates the communities of Broomhill and Thornwood in Glasgow in successfully campaigning for the reinstatement of the number 83 bus; believes that First Bus reversed its decision to axe this service and will now reinstate the bus on the route on 7 January 2001 as a result of the huge public outcry, and notes that the bus operator has also bowed to community pressure and agreed to cover the route from Monday 13 November 2000 until 7 January 2001 with a temporary bus numbered 6A. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Michael McMahon
S1M-1342 Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus (lodged on 10 November 2000) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1342 Pauline McNeill: Reinstatement of the Number 83 First Bus-That the Parliament congratulates the communities of Broomhill and Thornwood in Glasgow in successfully campaigning for the reinstatement of the number 83 bus; believes that First Bus reversed its decision to axe this service and will now reinstate the bus on the route on 7 January 2001 as a result of the huge public outcry, and notes that the bus operator has also bowed to community pressure and agreed to cover the route from Monday 13 November 2000 until 7 January 2001 with a temporary bus numbered 6A. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Michael McMahon, Ms Sandra White
